concept.title: Part 1: Swap Positions in Workday HCM

conbody.p: This manual is intended for the managers and the administrators of Workday HCM (Workday) to swap the positions for the existing workers. The readers of this guide are assumed to have experience working on the previous Swap Position feature.

Until now, the managers and administrators had to create temporary (dummy) positions for the workers involved in the swap and to mark their positions available for the swap participants. The workers and the swap participants were then moved to their originally intended positions.
This was not only a cumbersome process but also involved additional complicated tasks like job changes in the worker’s history, possible clerical errors, or issues with the manual entries.

Perform seamless swap positions at once for individuals or the group of workers in rotation or reorganizations. The new feature also reduces the errors and automates the manual efforts by enabling you to:

ul.li: Swap workers’ positions and assignments for the organization at the same time with ease, and in the same one-stop-shop location.
Define different reasons for performing swaps in Workday.
List down the workers for the future swap positions.
Ensure that the workers have the same job profiles defined in Workday before and after a position or assignment swap.

conbody.p: The new Swap Position feature performs the swap of an individual or a group of workers in a single transaction. The use cases include the following scenarios:

ol.li: In banking: Tellers and personal bankers often change their seats to switch locations, or hours more easily. This works better for their schedules.
In law enforcement: Workers bid on multiple assignments which are granted based on seniority or tenure.
Shift rotations: Workers that are in rotational programs need to move or rotate from one position to the other (e.g. from position A to B, or from position B to C).

Mass reorganizations: Thousands of workers change positions, organizations, locations, and managers on an annual basis as a part of a larger reorganization which might happen periodically throughout the year.

conbody.p: 1.3 Procedure to complete a position swap
There are 3 major steps involved in performing a complete Swap Position task as mentioned below.

p.note: The fields marked with asterisks (*) are required and must be completed.

ol.li: Type the query in the search box within the Find Workers report.
Narrow the results by using the available filters in the Current Search.
Check the corresponding boxes to select the worker/s.
Press the Add to Swap Positions List and type the name to create the list of workers to be swapped.

ul.li: Use Saved Searches to retrieve the workers saved earlier
Use Compare to see if you are swapping the correct positions.

p.b: Step 2: Add to Swap Positions list

conbody.p: 1. Select from the Swap Position List drop-down menu and press OK.

ol.li: Select the appropriate Reason or reasons for the swap. Read Maintain Event Categories and Reasons task for more information.
Optional step: Check the box Use Swap Position List to choose from the available list.

conbody.p: Enter the Event Title identify individual workers one-at-a-time.

ol.li: Optional step: Define the Proposed Position for each swapped worker in the events like the changes in the job description, promotion, transfers, etc.

conbody.p: 2. Enter the optional comments and press Submit.
